data.title: The 50+ Best NBA Phoenix Suns Shooting Guards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 50+ Best NBA Phoenix Suns Shooting Guards. Current Top 3: Devin Booker, Walter Davis, Joe Johnson
data.text:
Ranked By

1.7K votes

295 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Phoenix Suns

Big fan of Phoenix basketball? Then check out this list of Phoenix Suns shooting guards. It includes almost every shooting guard from throughout Phoenix Suns history, including current shooting guards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA shooting guards of all time, the best Suns SGs include Devin Booker, Paul Westphal, Walter Davis, Dan Majerle, Raja Bell, and Charlie Scott.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Phoenix Suns starting SGs and backup SGs are Devin Booker, Landry Shamet, and Chandler Hutchison.

Who are the best shooting guards in Phoenix Suns history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Phoenix Suns shooting guard of all time!

Most divisive: Johnny High

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 50+ Best NBA Phoenix Suns Shooting Guards

Birthplace : Grand Rapids, Michigan

Nationality : American

Team : Phoenix Suns

Position : Forward-center

Phoenix Suns: 2015-2022

A highly-touted prospect, Devin Booker was drafted by the Phoenix Suns in 2015 and quickly established himself as a franchise cornerstone. Booker's smooth shooting stroke and off-the-dribble scoring prowess have made him one of the most potent offensive weapons in the league. In addition to his scoring acumen, Booker is also a gifted playmaker, creating opportunities for his teammates. As an individual testament to his talent, he was named an NBA All-Star in both 2020 and 2021.

Birthplace : Pineville, North Carolina

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Phoenix Suns: 1977–1988

Walter Davis, known as "The Greyhound" for his speed and grace on the court, was drafted by the Phoenix Suns in 1977 and made an immediate impact with his scoring ability. A six-time NBA All-Star and the Suns' all-time leading scorer, Davis helped carry the team to numerous playoff appearances during his tenure. His smooth jumper and knack for getting to the rim made him a nightmare for opposing defenses. Davis' stellar performance earned him the 1978 NBA Rookie of the Year award, solidifying his status as a Suns legend.

Birthplace : Little Rock, Arkansas

Nationality : American

Team : Phoenix Suns, Atlanta Hawks, Brooklyn Nets, Miami Heat, Utah Jazz

Position : Shooting guard

Phoenix Suns: 2001–2005

Drafted in 2001, Joe Johnson quickly blossomed into a versatile scoring threat for the Phoenix Suns. With his size, shooting touch, and ability to create his own shot, Johnson helped revitalize the Suns' offense during his time with the team. A key player during the Suns' resurgence in the mid-2000s, Johnson was a vital component alongside Amar'e Stoudemire, Steve Nash, and Shawn Marion. While Johnson would eventually leave the Suns, his time with the team was marked by exciting play and impressive individual prowess.

Birthplace : Torrance, California

Nationality : American

Team : Boston Celtics, Phoenix Suns, Seattle SuperSonics, New York Knicks

Position : Guard

Phoenix Suns: 1975–1980, 1983–1984

Drafted by the Boston Celtics in 1972, Paul Westphal joined the Phoenix Suns via trade in 1975 and instantly became one of the key contributors to the team. An electrifying scorer and exceptional playmaker, Westphal led the Suns to their first NBA Finals appearance in 1976 in a thrilling series against his former team. A five-time NBA All-Star and four-time All-NBA selection, Westphal's number 44 jersey was rightly retired by the Suns, immortalizing his contributions to the franchise.

Birthplace : Traverse City, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Miami Heat, Cleveland Cavaliers, Phoenix Suns

Position : Shooting guard

Phoenix Suns: 1988–1995, 2001–2002

Dan Majerle was selected by the Phoenix Suns in the 1988 NBA Draft and became an integral part of the team's success throughout the 1990s. Known for his tenacious defense and exceptional three-point shooting, Majerle earned the nickname "Thunder Dan" due to his thunderous dunks. A three-time NBA All-Star and a two-time All-Defensive Second Team honoree, Majerle was a crucial component on the Suns' 1993 Finals team that battled against the Chicago Bulls.

Birthplace : Elmhurst, Illinois

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Phoenix Suns

Position : Shooting guard

Phoenix Suns: 1986–1992

Acquired in a trade in 1986, Jeff Hornacek quickly emerged as one of the most reliable shooting guards in Phoenix Suns history. Boasting a fundamentally sound game and unparalleled court vision, Hornacek thrived as both a scorer and a playmaker. His unselfish play and high basketball IQ made him a fan favorite during his tenure with the Suns. While not laden with individual accolades, Hornacek's impact on the Suns was invaluable, making him a beloved figure in franchise history.
